alert.note: Alert for Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:08AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN MASON, LEWIS AND SOUTHERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 545 AM EST... At 507 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Mount Carmel, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Manchester, Vanceburg, Lewisburg, Tollesboro, Rome, Blue Creek, Concord, Trinity, Kinniconick, Rectorville, Epworth, Ribolt, Charters, Petersville, Stricklett, Helena, Sandy Springs, Mount Gilead and Carrs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
